answers.answer: I don't have a history of migraines... I've only had a migraine twice before...idk if this is even a migraine. Maybe baby is on a nerve?
My OB called in a script for fioricet. ...I will see how it works...
You might be dehydration, try to drink more water and ice is better for pain,put a ice pack  on the back of neck or temples. Hope that helps! Good luck
Fiorcet works really well for migraines I had them in a previous pregnancy and it was a life saver.
Also if you put peppermint oil on temples behind ears and base of neck it does wonders

The meds worked, finally no more pain! I'm going to watch it on how many I take though because I guess that this is an addictive medication. The OBs nurse said they're totally fine in pregnancy but I'm going to be cautious any way....Thanks ladies: )

I just went to the hospital yesterday because I've had severe headaches and dizzy, vision change, and nausea for 5 days and they did lab work to find out I was dehydrated. I really thought I was drinking enough so try forcing more fluids

question: I'm 23 weeks pregnant and I've had neck pain for 5 days now and a headache for 2. Yesterday while driving I lost vision in my left eye and half in my right eye. It went away then I drove home and I lost my vision again. I went to the hospital since I have a bad hx of eclampsia and preeclampsia. L&D cleared me with no preeclampsia but my OB refused to give me even any nausea meds or Tylenol. I've had a headache for 2 days now, neck pain for 5... I took Tylenol at home and been using a heating pad but it barely touches the pain. I just want to cry from pain and frustration. ER and l&d were sending me back and forth between them btw...
title: migraines
